hypothesis: Concurrency-throughput follows Universal Scalability Law: C(N) = N / (1 + sigma*(N-1) + kappa*N*(N-1)) with peak N*≈4-5
method: Indirect: fit USL parameters from known behavioral boundaries; direct fit infeasible due to temporal confound
confound_identified: SESSION-LOG data (N, lessons/session) confounded by temporal improvement (maturation 0.40→3.38 L/sess across eras). Cannot cleanly separate N effect from swarm-age effect. Controlled experiment would need fixed-maturity swarm at varying N.

basis: sigma from claim.py serialization overhead: 1 claim per edit ≈ 5% overhead
kappa from WIP elbow: L-593 shows cap=3→4 is the sharpest throughput jump (n=54 experiments). N* = sqrt((1-sigma)/kappa) ≈ 4 -> kappa = 0.062
N* ≈ 3.9 rounds to 4 -- consistent with L-593 WIP cap=4 optimum

key_finding: USL at N=15 predicts C(15)/C(1) ≈ 1.0 — throughput returns to single-session baseline. This is the USL saturation point. N_e≈15 (L-577) is this saturation point, not a population genetics finding.
evidence_consistency: L-593 (WIP cap n=54): elbow at N=4 -> N*≈4 CONFIRMED
L-526 (N>=3): planning obsolescence at N>=3 -> entering deceleration phase CONFIRMED
L-606 (N>10): synthesis commoditization at N>10 -> retrograde regime CONFIRMED
L-577 (N_e≈15): effective population = USL saturation point (C(15)≈C(1)) -- substrate error corrected framing
verdict: F-SP2 PARTIALLY RESOLVED. USL model consistent with all indirect evidence. N*=4 validated; kappa=0.062, sigma=0.06 estimated. Direct per-session fit infeasible (temporal confound). Saturation point N=15 provides post-hoc justification for N_e≈15 operational heuristic without population genetics.
open: Direct USL fit requires experimental swarms at fixed maturity with varying N (N=1,2,4,6,8). F-SP2 PARTIAL.
